AllPosts.Header: Is it finally the time to announce that JAVA is dead ??
AllPosts.Body: JAVA 18 has been recently released and the developers could not be anymore disappointed than this. Another update and another shit-housery from the JAVA devs. No real update since JAVA8 and JAVA-lovers are just fed up at this point. The community is raging and a mass portion of them are trying to switch to the .NET programming due its constant update. Fellow developers , please dont hesitate to give your opinions.

Comments.Body: I agree, JAVA has been long dead. People should have realized this earlier. But better late than never, i guess.. But we .NET developers promise that we will welcome you guys with love
JAVA is shit. C# is best
I am also going to make my employees use .NET from now on. No JAVA on facebook  #SayNoToJAVA

AllPosts.Header: :NET 6.5 has been released and its controversial.
AllPosts.Body: Hello fellow developers !!. .NET 6.5 has been put forward yesterday. The release documentation stated that the new version is getting rid of the null-pointer exception. The developers need to specify now, with a very cheeky "?" sign to let the compiler know the variable is nullable. According to the .NET devs , null-pointer exception was the last year's biggest nightmare as reports suggests it was 49.253% of time the main reason over 27.36% of company crashing over. However, the reaction from the community is mixed. Most old devs are criticizing this saying , its not because of the exception but due to the new noob devs while majority of new programmers adore the concept.
